title: 110_hr333
content: The Act is titled the "Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act" and allows military retirees with service-connected disabilities to receive both retired pay and veterans' disability compensation concurrently. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act amends section 1414 of title 10, United States Code to include retirees with service-connected disabilities rated less than 50 percent and disability retirees with less than 20 years of service. It also repeals the phase-in of concurrent receipt of retired pay and veterans' disability compensation. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act amends section 1414 of title 10, United States Code to include disability retirees with less than 20 years of service. Retired pay for these retirees is subject to reduction under specific sections, but only if it exceeds a certain calculation based on years of service and retired pay base. The heading and table of sections for section 1414 of title 10, United States Code are amended to allow concurrent payment of retired pay and disability compensation for eligible members. Members eligible for retired pay can now receive veterans' disability compensation concurrently. Section 1413a(f) is amended to reflect this change. The effective date for these amendments is the first day of the first month after the enactment of the Act. Additionally, combat-related special compensation eligibility is now available for Chapter 61 military retirees with less than 20 years of service. Members eligible for retired pay can now receive veterans' disability compensation concurrently. Section 1413a of title 10, United States Code, is amended to specify eligibility criteria and computation adjustments for combat-related disabled uniformed services retirees. The amendments made by this section allow members eligible for retired pay to receive veterans' disability compensation concurrently, with specified eligibility criteria and computation adjustments for combat-related disabled uniformed services retirees. The effective date for these changes is the first day of the first month after the enactment of the Act, applying to payments starting from that date.
